title: 103_hr5098
content: The "Fort Peck Tribes-Montana Compact Act of 1994" approves and ratifies the water rights agreement between the Fort Peck Indian Tribes and Montana. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for water rights confirmed in the Tribes by the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, subject to Secretary approval within specified timeframes. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes can enter into Water Agreements for confirmed water rights, subject to Secretary approval within specific timeframes. Parties can enforce agreement provisions as per section 1361 of title 28, United States Code. The Department of the Interior must treat certain information related to Water Agreements as privileged, proprietary information of the Tribes. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes can enter into Water Agreements for confirmed water rights, subject to Secretary approval within specific timeframes. The Tribes may not enter into any Water Agreement allowing the use of tribal water rights outside the Basin. An "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established in the Treasury, funded by a percentage of receipts from the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Project, not to exceed $50,000,000 annually. The Secretary of the Treasury shall deposit interest accruing on funds in a separate account for the Secretary of the Interior to make payments to the Tribes for economic development and land acquisition purposes. Amounts deposited in the fund are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable. The Act allows for the acquisition of lands within the Reservation from willing sellers and their improvement, subject to the Secretary's approval. Payments from the fund are nonreimbursable and nonreturnable. These payments do not affect federal services or programs for the Tribes, are not subject to income tax, and do not impact power rates. No funds are distributed on a per capita basis to Tribe members. The Tribes waive claims against the United States in exchange for the required actions and funding. The Tribes waive claims against the United States in exchange for the required actions and funding, including the congressional authorization, appropriation, and payment of all funds for the Fund. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. This section defines key terms for the Act, including the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, Reservation, Secretary, Tribes, tribal water right, and Fund.
